sourceMeaningMnemonic: Where do you put your <radical>fingers</radical> when you're on an <radical>escalator</radical>? On the <kanji>handle</kanji>! Okay, so maybe it's not a handle and more of a railing, but for the sake of this kanji, picture a handle instead.
meaningInfo: Imagine being on an escalator and wrapping your fingers around a small handle on your way up or down. It's still a bit precarious, truth be told.
readingMnemonic: You put your hand on the <kanji>handle</kanji> and an old person leans in close to you and says, "<reading><ja>暑か</ja></reading>?" (<ja>あつか</ja>). He wants to know if the handle is ... hot? Before you can respond he says it again, and again! “<ja>暑か？！ 暑か？！？！ 暑か？！？！？！</ja>” he's shouting as you slowly ride the escalator away from him.
readingInfo: <ja>暑か</ja>? Is the handle hot? Think about it. Is it? What does your imagination tell you?
